pull.title: [RPC] getblock: Added help text for chainwork value
pull.body:
I took the text from bitcoin.org's description. @harding Is this originally from there?  

edit: Changed the wording

rename.from: Added help text for chainwork value
rename.to: [RPC] Added help text for chainwork value

issue.title: Fix help, add RPC tests for getblockheader
issue.body:
Continuing to chip away at the untested RPC interface. This PR:
- adds tests for `getblockheader` (previously uncovered)
- adds missing documentation to the `getblockheader` RPC help
- adds two assertion utilities to the RPC testing framework

events.body: @instagibbs yes; that description was written by me based upon my reading of the code.

rename.from: [RPC] Added help text for chainwork value
rename.to: [RPC] getblock: Added help text for chainwork value

events.message: Added help text for chainwork value

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -384,6 +384,7 @@ UniValue getblock(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"nonce\" : n,           (numeric) The nonce\n"
             "  \"bits\" : \"1d00ffff\", (string) The bits\n"
             "  \"difficulty\" : x.xxx,  (numeric) The difficulty\n"
+            "  \"chainwork\" : \"xxxx\",  (string) The estimated number of block header hashes checked from the genesis block to this block, in hexadecimal\n"
comments.body: I don't understand this sentence. I like `(string) Expected number of hashes required to produce the current chain (in hex)` better.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -384,6 +384,7 @@ UniValue getblock(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"nonce\" : n,           (numeric) The nonce\n"
             "  \"bits\" : \"1d00ffff\", (string) The bits\n"
             "  \"difficulty\" : x.xxx,  (numeric) The difficulty\n"
+            "  \"chainwork\" : \"xxxx\",  (string) The estimated number of block header hashes checked from the genesis block to this block, in hexadecimal\n"
comments.body:
What don't you understand about it specifically? Would:  

> (string) Expected number of hashes required to produce the chain up to this block (in hex)  

be better? As-is it's ambiguous to what "current chain" means. In getblockchaininfo it clearly means the valid chain with most work.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -384,6 +384,7 @@ UniValue getblock(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"nonce\" : n,           (numeric) The nonce\n"
             "  \"bits\" : \"1d00ffff\", (string) The bits\n"
             "  \"difficulty\" : x.xxx,  (numeric) The difficulty\n"
+            "  \"chainwork\" : \"xxxx\",  (string) The estimated number of block header hashes checked from the genesis block to this block, in hexadecimal\n"
comments.body:
> block header hashes

is not immediately clear what this means. Usually blocks with hashes that don't hit the diff are not considered valid, so they are not counted. Then "estimated" gives the hint that they are counted as well.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -384,6 +384,7 @@ UniValue getblock(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"nonce\" : n,           (numeric) The nonce\n"
             "  \"bits\" : \"1d00ffff\", (string) The bits\n"
             "  \"difficulty\" : x.xxx,  (numeric) The difficulty\n"
+            "  \"chainwork\" : \"xxxx\",  (string) The estimated number of block header hashes checked from the genesis block to this block, in hexadecimal\n"
comments.body: @instagibbs I like your suggestion as well.
